page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: {Dechmont Castle}was sited north-east of Meldrum School and was burned down in 1906. A new Dechmont House now stands on that site. Some parts of the battlements still remain. Our School was named after{Edward Meldrum}who owned Dechmont Castle and was a successful manufacturing chemist who, in association with William Binning and{James 'Paraffin' Young,}set up works to produce and refine oil from shale. This industry was really the beginning of the{British Oil Industry. Some other housing in our area is late 19th or 20th century but in the Deans area it is all new estates built since 1970. The estates either belong to the {Livingston Development Corp.}or are privately owned and are terraced, semi-detached or detached.
